comment: Run. I swear he picks the most complicated way to teach the information. You have to do it exactly his way or you don't get points. Grade consists of 4 tests. He goes by coach Sims, so a lot of people review him by that name. He doesn't use the text book, he makes up his own notes so you do not have anything to look at besides your notes.

I struggled from the beginning. KEEP ALL YOUR TESTS AND QUIZZES AND THEIR KEYS. I thought I was going to fail but I studied all the previous tests for the final and ended up with a b! Tough grader but not on the final! Your grade on your final can be used as your final overall grade so study hard!

I highly recommend NOT taking his class. He is rather unclear from time to time, and occasionally will mess up the problems he shows us in class. There's no textbook to use only his notes that he posts or writes in class.

I hated this class. Every math class I have ever taken in college I've made A's in and I made a C in his class. He does not use a book so there is nothing to reference other than your notes. He has pop quizzes so you need to go to class. Although the material may seem easy, his test questions are way more advance then how he explains things. AVOID!

Coach Sims is passionate about math, but he did not teach this class as it should have been taught. We did not use the book, but instead used handouts he created. Very specific on tests/quizzes, but he is lenient on some grades.

Coach Sims teaches this class as it is a high level college class and not a basic numbers class as it is supposed to be. He does not use the book and makes ups his own way of teaching the material. Most of the material he teaches is not supposed to be for the course. STAY AWAY FROM THIS PROFESSOR.

No attendance policy (but you WANT to be there bc you will miss a lot since he doesn't use the textbook) no homework, tests and quizzes are hard. He makes up his own way of doing math which is frustrating because he wants it done his very specific way, right down to the right terms but I really learned a lot from the class, it was SO insightful!
Very helpful and clear with his lectures. He likes to joke and is always enthusiastic and humorous; keeps things interesting. Offers bonus questions frequently which allows for grades above 100%

I'm currently in his class for another 3 weeks.  I have an A now.  Coach Sims is funny and tries to keep the class interested  His tests are mirrored from the worksheets he posts online.  Come to class, take his notes, use and complete all online worksheets, and you will do fine.  He doesn't use text book at all.  Don't buy it.

This class can be difficult if you slack. Ask questions, try to grasp the content he teaches. You are responsible for your grade, since there is no homework assigned or turned in, you really need to buckle down and study yourself. If you do so, you will pass just fine. Plenty of opportunities to pass. He is funny,kind,& helpful if you just ask.

I don't understand why people say not to take this class. Honestly, if you go to class every day and take good notes, you will do fine. He puts worksheets in Vista that are almost identical to the tests. He is very funny, approachable, and overall a really good professor. You have plenty of grade opportunities. This class is not hard.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS! I really enjoy math and always do well in it, but this class was awful. It is a class taken by elementary ed majors but none of us understand. Quizzes are given almost every week and you are expected to know his exact definitions to pass tests.  It was honestly a confusing waste of time.

This class is a basic numbers & operations class for people who will be teaching elementary school. However, it ended up being the hardest class I think I'll ever take. Taught things that didn't exist in order to teach things that do (?). Made us pretend we use a base 4 system (where 3+1=0) instead of a base 10 system. So confusing. Don't take!

The class was a lot harder than I had expected. If you go to class and spend a good bit of time studying outside of class, you should be fine. It is definitely time consuming, and he is a pretty difficult teacher. He wont tell you in the beginning, but if you are satisfied with your grade at the end of the semester, you don't have to take the final
